title: Don't See Your Role Here
description: The Graph is an indexing protocol for querying networks like Ethereum and IPFS. Anyone can build and publish open APIs called subgraphs making data easily accessible. Web3 is a new stack for a radically better internet. All data is stored and processed on open networks with verifiable integrity. The Graph makes querying this data fast reliable and secure. By combining web3 protocols developers can build dapps with powerful new features for solving the worlds greatest challenges. The Graph Foundation is committed to supporting the long-term health and growth of The Graph ecosystem. We help interested parties engage with the community. Are you interested in joining The Graph ecosystem but donât see a job posting that matches your interests background skills or abilities? Please tell us what weâre missing! Use this application form to pitch your own position. There are a lot of roles we need but arenât actively hiring for yet. Please help us to better understand what youâd like to work on and âwhyâ weâre missing this key role or skill set within The Graphâs ecosystem. Other Ways To Get Involved: While weâre waiting for your perfect role to open within The Graph ecosystem below are a couple other ways you can get involved. If interested please follow the appropriate steps described on each respective page:   Grants Program - The goal of the Grants Program is to encourage development on The Graphâs network and tooling collaboration with third-party developers expand the usage of subgraphs and grow the community of network participants. Here is an article explaining a little more about the Grants Program (as well as The Graph Council).  Advocates Program - A community-driven initiative serving as a portal intro web3 for people all across the world.  About the Graph: The Graph is the indexing and query layer of web3. The Graph Networkâs self service experience for developers launched in July 2021. Developers build and publish open APIs called subgraphs that applications can query using GraphQL. The Graph supports indexing data from multiple different networks including Ethereum NEAR Arbitrium Optimism Polygon Avalanche Celo Fantom Moonbeam IPFS and PoA with more networks coming soon. To date tens-of-thousands of subgraphs have been deployed on the hosted service and now subgraphs can be deployed directly on the network. Over 28 000 developers have built subgraphs for applications such as Uniswap Synthetix KnownOrigin Art Blocks Balancer Livepeer DAOstack Audius Decentraland and many others. If you are a developer building an application or web3 application you can use subgraphs for indexing and querying data from blockchains. The Graph allows applications to efficiently and performantly present data in a UI and allows other developers to use your subgraph too! You can deploy a subgraph to the network using the newly launched Subgraph Studio or query existing subgraphs that are in the Graph Explorer. The Graph would love to welcome you to be Indexers  Curators and/or Delegators on The Graphâs mainnet. Join The Graph community by introducing yourself in The Graph Discord for technical discussions join The Graphâs Telegram chat and follow The Graph on Twitter  LinkedIn  Instagram  Facebook  Reddit and Medium! The Graphâs developers and members of the community are always eager to chat with you and The Graph ecosystem has a growing community of developers who support each other. The Graph Foundation oversees The Graph Network. The Graph Foundation is overseen by the Technical Council. Edge & Node  StreamingFast  Figment  Semiotic and The Guild are five of the many organizations within The Graph ecosystem.   Please mention the word **PLEASURABLE** and tag RMjgwNjoyZjA6NzQyMDpmY2UzOjIwNTQ6YTlmYToyYjo2YTM4 when applying to show you read the job post completely (#RMjgwNjoyZjA6NzQyMDpmY2UzOjIwNTQ6YTlmYToyYjo2YTM4). title: VP of Operations
description: Company Description   Trust Wallet is a leading self-custodial crypto wallet company dedicated to empowering individuals to take control of their digital assets securely and privately. We are at the forefront of the blockchain revolution offering user-friendly solutions for cryptocurrency enthusiasts and investors. As we continue to grow and innovate we are seeking a dynamic VP Operations to join our team. As the VP Operations of Trust Wallet you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of self-custodial cryptocurrency wallets. You will oversee multiple critical functions within the company including data analytics finance customer support legal & compliance and privacy. We are looking for a visionary leader with a strong problem-solving mindset the ability to rapidly adapt to evolving technical concepts and a passion for driving excellence in all aspects of our operations.    Job Description   Strategic Leadership: Collaborate with the executive team to develop and execute the companyâs strategic vision ensuring alignment with our mission and values. Data Analytics: Lead the data analytics function to extract actionable insights from user data enabling data-driven decision-making across the organization. Financial Management: Oversee financial planning budgeting and forecasting to ensure the companyâs financial health and sustainability. Customer Support: Manage and enhance our customer support team fostering a culture of exceptional service to our users. Legal & Compliance: Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements in the cryptocurrency industry working closely with legal and compliance experts to mitigate risks. Privacy: Champion privacy initiatives safeguarding user data and maintaining the highest standards of data protection. Cross-functional Collaboration: Foster collaboration between departments promoting a culture of innovation learning and continuous improvement. People management: Set priorities for coach and develop team members across the aforementioned departments.    Qualifications   Proven experience in a leadership role within the cryptocurrency or fintech industry. Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to navigate unique and complex challenges. Rapid learner who can grasp technical concepts and stay updated on industry trends. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to inspire and lead cross-functional teams. Comfort with ambiguity or rapidly changing environments Strong multi-project management skills. Strong people management and stakeholder management skills. Calm detailed non-aggressive personality.  Demonstrated success in driving operational excellence and efficiency. Commitment to upholding the highest standards of data privacy and compliance.    Additional Information   Why Join Trust Wallet  Be at the forefront of the cryptocurrency revolution. Work with a talented and passionate team. Shape the future of self-custodial crypto wallets. Competitive compensation and benefits package.  If you are a visionary leader who thrives in a dynamic and evolving industry we invite you to join us on this exciting journey. Apply today to become our VP Operations and help redefine the world of digital asset management.  Why work at Trust Wallet?  Be a part of the worldâs leading blockchain ecosystem that continues to grow and offers excellent career development opportunities. Work alongside diverse world-class talent in an environment where learning and growth opportunities are endless. Tackle fast-paced challenging and unique projects. Work in a truly global organization with international teams and a flat organizational structure. Enjoy competitive salary and benefits. Balance life and work with flexible working hours and casual work attire.  Apply today to join our team in building the worldâs most trusted and secure crypto wallet and enable a decentralized future for everyone.  Trust Wallet is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. We believe that having a diverse workforce is fundamental to our success. By submitting a job application you confirm that you have read and agree to our Candidate Privacy Notice. title: Professional Development Learning Facilitators - National
description: Who We Are:Zearn is the nonprofit educational organization whose mission is to inspire all kids to love learning math. Everything we do is driven by our belief that every kid is a math kid. Our top-rated learning platform is designed to catch kids up and move them forward in grade-level math. And it works. Large-scale efficacy research shows students who use Zearn make significant gains in math proficiency including the students who start multiple grade levels behind. As a nonprofit all of our work is driven by what is best for kids. At the same time we operate as an intense and fast-moving technology company inclusively solving hard problems that will impact current and future generations. The problems we solve require expertise in pedagogy software development persuasion psychology design writing video production problem solving and countless other disciplines. As an organization that is always stretching to get to the next level of impact every single person owns mission critical work. If you’re ready to join our Team of problem solvers and own work that will drive us to achieve impact at scale we are looking for you. Learn more about us at https://about.zearn.org/.Who We Are Looking For:If you love working with elementary and middle school math teachers and enjoy leading professional development the Zearn Professional Learning Facilitator role is right for you. Zearn Math is seeking excited and passionate Professional Learning Facilitators to lead professional learning with Zearn teachers and administrators from all across the country. Your responsibilities will be challenging and diverse. You will start by immersing yourself in Zearn facilitator training getting the opportunity to be trained on Zearn content and facilitation by one of our expert facilitators. You will then dive right in by leading professional development sessions both over video conferencing and in person for district teachers and leaders around the country. To grow your own skills you will participate in team professional development and individualized coaching. Ultimately your facilitation will have a significant impact by helping thousands of teachers and leaders learn to implement Zearn effectively which in turn will help millions of children develop a love of learning math.What This Role Will Do:Preparation & InstructionParticipate in ongoing facilitator training and development. This includes learning and developing expertise in: seamless approachable and engaging facilitation all areas of the Zearn product and curricular materials the research-based approach used to develop Zearn the phases key actions and milestones involved in Zearn implementation Prepare to facilitate a broad range of professional learning sessions for a wide range of educators and leaders. This includes: studying and internalizing content for a range of sessions preparing materials practicing with other team members receiving and incorporating feedback from managers and other team members Session Facilitation  Facilitate remote and onsite professional development sessions for all of our partners nationwide Travel to 1-4 different locations across the country each week to deliver in-person training to teachers and leaders.  Facilitate sessions in the early morning and early evening as well as on various weekends and holidays depending on time zones and partner needs.  Professional Development & Support  Adopt a mindset of continuous learning and improvement; exhibit an eagerness to grow as a facilitator. Analyze and reflect on survey data after each session to make aligned shifts in preparation for subsequent facilitation Debrief strengths and growth areas from session observations and survey data in regular meetings with a manager. Engage in practice before sessions with other team members to prepare for facilitation and receive additional feedback.  What You’ll Bring To The Role: Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field required. 3+ years of experience teaching K-8 and/or math  Willingness to travel and work irregular hours (including various mornings evenings weekends and holidays) Comfort working in a highly collaborative environment with excellent time management skills and attention to detail Receptivity to multiple viewpoints and feedback with a focus on reflective practice and innovation Empathy curiosity and the desire to continually grow as a learner and teammate Experience using Zearn in your school or classroom is strongly preferred Some experience leading professional learning for teachers and/or leaders is preferred  Strong relevant content area knowledge is preferred (e.g. math instruction adult pedagogy supporting diverse learners)  A commitment to Zearn’s mission of providing an exceptional education to all children A desire to join an entrepreneurial fast-paced environment at a high-growth organization Location: This role is remote and will focus on providing professional learning sessions across the country. It will require up to 90% travel across the year (1-4 different locations a week) and therefore candidates must live within one hour of one the following hub airports:  Boston (BOS)  Charlotte (CLT)  Chicago (ORD)  Cincinnati (CVG)  Cleveland (CLE)  Dallas (DFW)  Detroit (DTW)  Houston (IAH) NYC area airports (JFK LGA EWR/Newark) Philadelphia (PHL)  Raleigh-Durham (RDU) Washington DC (DCA) Compensation & Benefits:The compensation range for this role is $75 000 - $80 000 per year.We offer a competitive benefits package including comprehensive medical dental and vision plans short- and long-term disability life insurance 401K matching parental leave a generous Holiday policy and a flexible PTO policy. We also offer a collegial and passionate culture and the potential to positively impact the lives of millions of children.Zearn is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications merit and business need.TO APPLY:https://apply.workable.com/j/9DE7898DEE

title: Senior iOS Developer
description: Work from anywhere impact everywhere  We’re a fully distributed team of over 150 talented people that work remotely from 40+ countries around the world. We work hard think globally and inspire each other to learn and grow. We are committed to changing the way things are done. To achieve that we search the world for the best people for the job. This is how we are transforming the world of digital banking.  Our team is worldwide our capacity for innovation limitless. Risk is inherent in all of our business activities and managing risk well is the responsibility of every Xapien. Sound risk management enables us to serve our customers and deliver value for our shareholders and helps make Xapo a great place to work. Although we are headquartered in Gibraltar this is a full time 100% remote position Work from anywhere!    Position overview At Xapo we are building truly cross functional teams with full ownership of design architecture build and test. You will collaborate closely with your fellow team members from the product backend design and QA communities of practice. Responsibilities As a Senior iOS Developer you will be responsible for building components of our mobile app that will enable users all over the world to send spend save and receive money and Bitcoin safely and globally. The impact of what you will help develop at Xapo will help people protect their life savings. If you are a passionate enthusiastic engineer interested in revolutionizing the world of banking join us! Our tech stack includes:  Latest Swift   Our own UI Component Library (Mostly SwiftUI but still we have some UIKit remaining) Unit tests snapshot tests integration tests UITests Swift Package Manager Kotlin Multiplatform  Requirements:  5+ years’ experience in iOS development Swift. SwiftUI experience. Experience working with code sharing pull requests and code reviews (Git). Experience working with teams in an agile environment (Jira). Passion for clean code where re-usability testability and readability are a must (SOLID). Experience with the tech stack described above. A good understanding of software architecture & object-oriented design patterns Self-motivated with initiative and enthusiasm willing to work with a remote team. Great communication skills in English.  Nice to have:  Experience in CI/CD (CircleCI) Fastlane and static code quality analytics. Experience in BDD. Kotlin including multiplatform KMM (believe it! — we use it both Android and iOS) Open source contributions. Experience with Combine Experience working with modular architectures Experience with Swift Package Manager Carthage Cocoapods Shipped successful iOS app(s) ideally still available in the App Store  Other requirements:  A dedicated workspace. A reliable internet connection with the fastest speed possible in your area. Devices and other essential equipment that meet minimal technical specifications. Alignment with Our Values.   Why work for Xapo? IMPACT GLOBALLY WORK REMOTELY.  Shape the Future: Improve lives through cutting-edge technology work 100% remotely from anywhere in the world. Great work-life balance: Build amazing things with a balance of autonomy and collaborative teamwork. Set your own work schedule and make use of a flexible PTO plan when you need to recharge.  Expect Excellence: Collaborate learn and grow with a high-performance team. Learn how you learn best - from books to conferences you’ll get a yearly budget for your individual learning and development goals.

title: Talent Acquisition Manager
description: We at n8n are building the most powerful flexible and open workflow automation platform for technical people out there. We were founded end of 2019 and currently: 📈 10k people try us out for the first time each month ⭐️ With 34k stars we are in the top 500 of the 238m projects on GitHub 🧑‍🤝‍🧑 We have a passionate and engaged community 🌱 We were Sequoias first seed investment in Germany and raised $12m Series A round in 2021 led by Felicis Ventures   As we are not done growing we are now looking for a second Talent Acquisition Manager to join our small but mighty team.   What you can expect day to day (80-90%): End-to-end recruitment with a focus on Commercial roles (GTM & Ops functions) with a focus on quality over quantity (we want to grow our headcount sensibly) Projects (10-20%): As we are a lean people and ops team (and team in general) there will be a need to also support other areas. Below are some ideas of projects you could work on (e.g. D&I Talent Development Support People Ops Work on improving n8n’s already great culture Employer branding) Requirements Must have’s  Proven experience in end-to-end recruitment with a strong emphasis on commercial roles in a dynamic fast-paced Technical enough to be excited about what we are building at n8n Obsessively committed to creating outstanding experiences for both internal and external stakeholders Possesses strong business acumen and is adept at working with data to drive informed decisions Driven and inherently curious always eager to acquire new knowledge and skills (this is super important) Humble kind and open to feedback (this is super duper important)    Nice to have (please do not shy away from applying even if you are not fulfilling any of these)  You have previous experience in other peoples functions or from working in a commercial role Experience working in a remote-first setting and hiring all over Europe Previously worked in a company building a product for technical people  Benefits  Career opportunities. We are looking to hire rising stars who can grow with the company into more senior roles. We give you €1k a year to spend on courses books events and coaching to support you in developing your career Remote-first work. Our team works remote from anywhere within Europe but we have regular off-sites to help build team bonds and alignment A passionate community. We love n8n’s community and open source ethos. We give you $100 per month to give to projects you care about Transparency. We all know what everyone’s working on how’s the company doing — the whole shebang A passionate team. We love our product. We have regular hackathons to see who can build the coolest thing with it Ownership. Our core value is to “empower others” and we give you a slice of n8n in the form of equity Sustainable work life. We work hard but make sure everyone can properly recharge their batteries with 30 days holiday plus public holidays wherever you are  n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race religion color national origin gender sexual orientation gender identity age marital status veteran status or disability status. We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country you need to have existing right to work. Our company language is English.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: We are looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our dedicated infrastructure team and help us develop maintain and administer our TileDB Cloud product. Your key responsibilities will include managing configuring and deploying infrastructure components such as Kubernetes clusters Redis MariaDB Cloudflare workers as well as developing tools to automate them. You will help to expand TileDB Cloud to other cloud providers such as Google Cloud Microsoft Azure and Alibaba Cloud along with improving our existing multi-region setup. You also will assist with establishing deployments of TileDB Cloud Enterprise edition for on-premise use.LocationOur headquarters are in Cambridge MA USA and we have a subsidiary in Athens Greece. You will have the flexibility to work remotely as long as your legal residence is in the USA and your normal working day falls within a continental US timezone.ExpectationsIn your first 30 days you will familiarize yourself with TileDB TileDB Cloud and our Kubernetes infrastructure. After 30 days you will be fully integrated in our team. You’ll be an active contributor and maintainer of the TileDB Cloud infrastructure and ready to start adding additional functionality.Requirements In-depth experience using Kubernetes for production service deployments Obsessed with infrastructure as code (we use Terraform) Experience running and managing databases In-depth knowledge of Linux networking and common protocols (DNS HTTP TCP etc.) Experience with performance monitoring tools (Prometheus Cloudwatch etc) Software engineering experience An automate-everything mindset Willing to handle on-call responsibilities as part of a team Nice-to-have Software development experience with Go C++ or Python Experience operating testing and debugging multi-language or distributed applications Benefits Competitive salary and stock options 100% medical and dental insurance coverage (for you and your dependents!) Paid parental leave Paid time off (vacation sick & public holidays) Flexible time off & flexible hours Flexibility to work remotely (continental US timezones) TileDB Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer building a diverse and inclusive team.

title: Exec Ops / Chief of Staff
description: We are seeking an exceptionally organized and strategic individual to serve as Exec Ops reporting directly to the CEO. As Exec Ops you will advise the CEO while coordinating their meetings travel and information flow. This is a high-impact role for someone who can translate the CEOs vision into operational excellence.   Responsibilities:   Provide comprehensive administrative support to the CEO   Manage busy calendar and complex scheduling for the CEO   Prepare documents presentations and correspondence on behalf of CEO   Facilitate communication and workflow between CEO and leadership team   Take detailed meeting minutes and track follow-up actions   Handle confidential matters with discretion   Proactively identify and recommend improvements to systems and processes   Manage high-priority cross-functional initiatives   Work with the CEO and department leads on strategic planning and goal setting     Requirements:   Superb organizational skills with ability to juggle multiple priorities   Excellent written and verbal communication abilities   High proficiency with productivity and collaboration tools   Proactive problem-solver able to work independently   Impeccable discretion when handling confidential information     Nice to Have:   Experience at a top management consulting firm like Bain BCG or McKinsey   Experience in a tech company role   Experience providing executive-level administrative support     In this unique role you will receive unparalleled access to the CEOs meetings and information flow. Following an initial 30-day intensive shadowing period you will take on additional responsibilities based on your skills and interests. There is significant opportunity for growth into broader operational leadership roles within the company. If you thrive on organization strategy and supporting dynamic leaders we encourage you to apply for this high-impact role.

title: Product Owner
description: Our Company  Moro Tech is a proud member of Moro Global with presence in Greece Cyprus Belgium and Japan while we continue to transform and grow. We support organizations at every step of their business-journey from planning to execution by adopting a hands-on approach and providing a powerful mix of business strategy technical domain expertise and data centric solutions. If you are the type of person who is committed to achieving outstanding results shows up as their whole self and values diversity and inclusion then be sure to check the job description below ‘cause we are looking forward to meeting you!   The impact of the role: This is an amazing opportunity to be part of the future of the automotive industry. Together with your peers you will be defining the future connected services for one of the largest OEMs in the world. As our Product Owner you will play a pivotal role in defining the product vision aligning the product roadmap with strategic goals and ensuring the successful deployment of projects.   On a given day a Product Owner will:  Have the ownership of our projects from ideation through development to launch growth and maintenance. Engage with a diverse group of stakeholders and clients to define a clear project vision and align it with strategic direction. Create and maintain a delivery plan while monitoring progress deviations and dependencies. Set success metrics and feature roadmap to align with business goals and drive the roadmap to completion.  Requirements In order to be successful in this role you will need:  Minimal 5 years of proven experience working in the product management field. Excellent communication and problem-solving skills along with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and clients. Previous experience with project management tools such as Jira Confluence MIRO. Proficiency in Agile/Scrum/SAFe methodologies. Any previous experience of working within projects related to smart mobility or smart cities would be greatly appreciated. We are a multinational company fluency in English is a must. We thrive through team collaboration we are on the lookout for team players. We encourage everyone to think out of the box; curiosity and willingness to learn new technologies and evolve as an individual and as a team member is highly appreciated.  Benefits Benefits for you:  We value each individuals values and unique skill set:  We offer a competitive remuneration package for what you bring in! We have all the right tools in place to enable your growth as our member with performance feedback Growth Plans bi annual Salary Reviews and more!   We take care of our people and value work life balance:  We offer an advantageous Private Health insurance We offer extra paid time off per year We offer monthly Meal Vouchers We offer flexible working hours   We have a people first approach and we are committed to providing our people the tools and power to thrive  We offer an annual budget for training activities We offer Mac equipment   We are location fluid with a work from anywhere mentality! Our offices offer a lot of collaboration spaces and is open for all of our Morotechies to come whenever they wish and collaborate in person!  Please note that benefits may vary based on the location. A glimpse at our principles: We move at the speed of culture. We are technologically and culturally agile having the mindset -we call it entrepreneurial spirit- to transform adapt be flexible in order to be updated and relevant always. We feel comfortable with the unknown. We have embraced uncertainty and we feel comfortable with the unknown as there is no other way to create lasting growth and real impact. We act with passion. We succeed with passion and we fail with passion. Everything we do our daily tasks our long-term projects internally and externally the way we are chasing our dreams and vision we do it passionately. We enjoy being diverse. We are committed to fostering an environment where we can celebrate and embrace our diversity and each persons individuality so that people can bring their whole selves to work. A mosaic of personalities views perspectives and crafts is who we are. We wouldnt have been the same otherwise. So simple.

title: Account Manager
description: We are searching for an Account Manager to join a design agency. Salary: £28 000-£35 000  Location: Remote. Job type: Permanent  About our client - the Worthy & True opinion  Award-winning design agency working with well-known and much loved FMCG brands.  This is an agency that are well versed developing standout and impactful brands with a portfolio that includes some of the most iconic products lining supermarket shelves. They specialize in the creation of visually stunning packaging designs and the execution of gold standard advertising and communication campaigns. An employer that truly embraces remote working they work predominantly remotely with the occasional travel to client offices required.  It’s also somewhere the importance of work life balance is recognised and encouraged.  Required skills & experience.  Your role will be to build and develop relationships with your clients to ensure you fully understand their business challenges and priorities. Take briefs from clients then work with internal experts to bring projects into fruition.  Ensure projects are delivered within allocated timescales and within budget. Attention to detail is critical for the role as you will be responsible for final sign off on designs ahead of these going to print. This is a remote role so it’s important that you are a self-starter. You will need to be able to work autonomously and plan your time effectively.  Previous experience working in an agency setting is essential ideally this will be gained in a packaging design agency however candidates with a clear passion for working with FMCG clients will also be considered. You could be an Account Executive ready to step up or could be an Account Manager ready for a new challenge. How to apply  Please upload your CV and feel free to tell us why you think you are right for the role.  Working with Worthy & True  We have been working with Account Managers and placing them in jobs since 2009. We build long term relationships with our candidates and clients lasting decades. We have integrity and represent and advise you in your job search with enthusiasm and care.   We aim to review all applications and give feedback as quickly as possible.  We only work with clients who offer inclusive supportive and safe working cultures where you can expect a great employee experience and be able to come to work as your true self. We also welcome neurodiverse individuals and applicants from ethnically diverse backgrounds

title: Graphic Design & Production Intern (Spring 2024)
description: Company Description WHO WE ARE Feeding San Diego comprises an ambitious team of individuals who believe that we can solve hunger in our community. We focus our daily work on the one in eight people facing hunger in San Diego County. Every day we work hand-in-hand with partner agencies local school districts corporate partners individual donors and a network of volunteers to provide food and resources to our neighbors in need. At the same time we protect the environment through the rescue of safe and wholesome food that would otherwise go to the landfill — simply because it is excess product does not adhere to market standards or is approaching a best by or use by date. Together with our partners Feeding San Diego provided over 40 million meals last year and served 63 000 children families and seniors each week. Feeding San Diego is dedicated to building a team that reflects the diverse county we serve including those with varying backgrounds and life experiences. Applicants who strengthen our team through personal knowledge of poverty and food insecurity as well as members of marginalized groups are encouraged to apply  Job Description POSITION SUMMARY This is an unpaid part-time position for college students with access to internship class credit for the spring 2024 semester (January through May 2024). You must be able to work a minimum of 12 hours per week. This position can be fully remote or hybrid depending on student’s location. Under the direction of the Brand Manager the Graphic Design & Production Intern is a key member of the marketing and communications department at Feeding San Diego. This role is responsible for designing a variety of print and digital materials including flyers signage digital ad creative and more as well as helping to maintain the Feeding San Diego media library and related creative production processes. The work of the Graphic Design & Production Intern helps drive brand awareness fundraising and community engagement goals.   ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES To perform this job successfully the individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   Graphic Design: · Create designs for collateral signage digital advertising and more using Adobe InDesign Adobe Illustrator and Canva · Assist with creative production for marketing campaigns and initiatives · Assist with graphic design for organic social media posts as needed   Creative Production: · Help maintain Feeding San Diego media library by uploading tagging and organizing photo and video files · Help maintain inventory and disbursement of collateral and signage orders · Assist with transcriptions and caption editing for video interviews and production Other duties as assigned by the Brand Manager      Qualifications QUALIFICATIONS: EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE Must be a current college student with access to college credit as internship compensation working towards a degree in graphic design art communications or related area of study. Experience with graphic design must be proven via a digital portfolio. Experience working or volunteering with a mission-based company or nonprofit a plus. QUALIFICATIONS: KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES · Commitment to hunger-relief and Feeding San Diego’s mission; compassion and appreciation for other hunger-related issues. · Proven experience with Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign and Illustrator required. Photoshop Premiere Pro and Acrobat a plus). · Experience with Canva · Please provide a link to your graphic design portfolio. Only applications with a portfolio will be considered. · Strong attention to detail organizational skills and ability to self-manage workload to meet firm deadlines. · Ability to work remotely take direction through virtual meetings and task management platforms and follow through on tasks with self-driven time management. · Access to a personal laptop and Adobe Creative Suite subscription  Additional Information

title: QA Specialist
description: 🌟 Allow us to introduce ourselves Ancient Gaming an innovative software creator for the future of iGaming bucks the trend that has lacked innovation for two decades. Were not trend followers; were trendsetters. As iGaming pioneers we challenge the status quo crafting not just appealing software but a whole new experience for the younger high-spending generation seeking to reinvent gaming interactions.   Founded in 2018 in Malta weve become a global presence with 50+ dedicated team members spanning 25+ countries. And yes were proudly remote-first!   🚀 Your mission as a QA Specialist! As a vital member of our team youll meticulously test and assess games identifying issues and ensuring flawless gameplay. Your expertise will drive the refinement of player experiences and contribute to our commitment to excellence.   What you’ll be doing:   Review requirements specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback.   Create detailed comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases.   Estimate prioritise plan and coordinate testing activities.   Identify record provide thorough documentation on and track bugs.   Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved.   Regular regression testing on the production environment to identify unreported bugs or areas for general quality improvement.   Liaise with customer support team and directly with customers via community chat portals to review and onboard valuable customer feedback.   Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needs.   Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements.   Monitor debugging process results.   Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies.    Examples of projects you’ll be working on:  CSGORoll: A community social gaming platform targeted towards CSGO players featuring unique in-house custom-built games such as Roulette Crash Unboxing and PVP. Users have the capability to bet and win Skins in real time. HypeDrop: A platform for buying and opening Mystery Boxes in real-time featuring an unboxing game where people can unbox real-life products and have them shipped to their houses. HypeUp: An iGaming brand where users can wager their balance or items from their Inventory against other peoples items such as watches electronics sneakers and more and can physically redeem their contents upon withdrawal. These projects use the same codebase and share libraries of components and modules   You will thrive in this role if you have:   Minimum 3 years of experience in a similar QA role.   Proficient understanding of web application functionalities including JavaScript/TypeScript GraphQL and WebSockets.   Demonstrated experience in API testing using tools like GraphQL Postman and SoapUI and creating custom scripts for API testing.   Experience with SQL databases including writing complex queries and understanding database schema design.   Good knowledge of Git.   Proven experience using issue-tracking platforms like Jira.   Experience with agile methodology.   Hands-on experience and knowledge in Smoke testing Sanity testing Manual end-to-end testing and Regression testing.     It will be good if you have:   Experience with performance testing tools like JMeter LoadRunner or similar to ensure backend scalability and reliability.   Experience with server-side rendering frameworks.   Knowledge of security best practices and experience with security testing.   A degree in Computer Science Information Technology or a related field.   What’s in it for you?  Flexibility Policy – Its about giving you the freedom to structure your workday in a way that best suits your lifestyle and responsibilities outside of work Work-from-anywhere Policy – you have the chance to work from anywhere in the world we are a remote-first company and we are proud of it! Every year for our team-building we choose a location and go there to celebrate our achievements together A dedicated budget to purchase all the equipment you need to set up your home office L&D budget for you to develop your skills! Spill Mental Health Service – full access to counselling for any employees who need it Young fun flat structured rapidly growing company with endless opportunities to grow A diverse portfolio that includes gamified e-commerce video game arcade and iGaming Entirely modern stack no legacy code!    This post not only outlines our ideal candidate but also serves as an inspiration for what this role can evolve into. Even if you consider yourself an 80% fit but have a genuine passion for this position we encourage you to apply. Were eager to hear from individuals who share our enthusiasm.  Ancient Gaming is an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity national origin veteran or disability status.

title: Content Writer (NLPL)
description: Are you a wizard with words? Were in search of a Content Writer who can weave magic through captivating content. Join us as we embark on a journey of storytelling excellence. Your spellbinding writing skills are the key!You will play a pivotal role in crafting enhancing and maintaining content to propel us toward our business goals. Your tasks will also include sharing content to raise brand awareness and monitoring web traffic and metrics to identify best practices.Our dream candidate is a detail-oriented experienced specialist with a proven flair for imaginative writing. Product: AI Business Analyst tool that automates customer support. The product is currently in production.Team: we already have an experienced CEO with a background in Data Science and Machine Learning Front-End Back-end Developers Machine Learning Engineer and a Marketing Manager.RequirementsWhat you need: At least 2+ years of proven experience as a technical writer or copywriter; Exceptional command of written English and Ukrainian; Experience doing research using multiple sources; Ability to write for multiple brand voices; High self-organization and ability to fulfil the commitments; Be an assiduous self-learner and have a proactive attitude; Understanding of the best practices for formatting articles for the web. What You Will Do: Writing clear compelling copy for various mediums: company site ads blog posts newsletters social media; Write clear marketing copy to promote our products/services and inform our community of readers; Use SEO guidelines regarding keyword research to increase web traffic; Coordinate with marketing and design teams to illustrate articles; Research industry-related topics (combining online sources interviews and studies); Write magnetic blog headlines that are click-worthy; Ensure all-around consistency (style fonts images and tone); Proofread and edit blog posts before publication; Identify customers’ needs and gaps in our content and recommend new topics; Conducting thorough research and interviews. Would be a plus: Hands-on experience with workflow tools (e.g. Confluence Jira Asana); Good sense of humour :)  BenefitsWe offer: Competitive compensation in USD; Business hours;  Opportunity to work remotely; Cosy start-up atmosphere with stability from a holding company; Lots of interesting talks and communication with the team; Great management with no bureaucracy.

title: Sr. Data & Analytics Engineer
description: About Landbot Operating in more than 40 countries Landbot (the most powerful No-Code Chatbot Builder) offers a platform that helps companies to create unbeatable chatbot conversations in different channels: Web WhatsApp and Messenger. With us you will be working in a team of engineers data designers PMs. A team with diverse and exciting backgrounds coordinated with agile methodologies No matter the location we put fun at the heart of everything we do and set ambitious goals to push things forward. Our Core Values   We’re looking for a Sr. Data Engineer with fullstack ambitions somebody who is able and willing to contribute throughout the whole lifecycle of building data products. Thus while your main domain expertise should be in Data Engineering we look for folks who are also able and interested in contributing with tasks that are usually more aligned with Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineering roles.   Responsibilities:  Designing developing and maintaining a common analytics platform to empower teams to build reports draw insights and build automations with their area’s tooling stack. Development of our data warehouse in conjunction with our Data Analysts/Scientists from provisioning the relevant cloud infrastructure managing the data ingestion pipelines and ensuring quality security and privacy through data governance. Partnering with product and engineering to enhance our data platform to enable experimenting and shipping AI/ML-powered products.   Experience building data products: gathering and understanding stakeholder pains agile product development up-to-date knowledge of the technology landscape to design appropriate solutions Experience building ELT/ETL data pipelines using the modern data stack (Data/delta lakes Airflow/Prefect/Dagster Bigquery/Redshift/Snowflake dbt reverse ETL) Proficient in SQL Python Experience implementing DevOps practices (CI/CD automation observability Infrastructure-as-Code) Experience provisioning and managing cloud infrastructure Eligibility to work in Spain  Nice to have 🏆  Experience with real-time or near-real-time data pipelines (ex: Kafka/PubSub Flink Storm Structured Streaming) Experience with the Google Cloud Platform and its analytics/data stack  Hiring Process 1️⃣ CV screening2️⃣ Phone screen with HR & Hiring Manager3️⃣ Technical take-home challenge4️⃣ Team presentation of challenge results5️⃣ CEO interview   Benefits 😍  Hybrid culture: you can choose between a full remote or a beautiful office in Barcelona (or both!). Great company culture we have a young upbeat and international work environment. Flexible schedule. Open vacation policy and flexible holidays so you can take time off when you need it. Training budget 📚 📖 Ticket transport 🚋 🏖 25 days of paid vacation (23 regular days + December 24th & 31st ) 🏖 English & Spanish lessons 🇬🇧 🇪🇸 Flex compensation with Cobee 💸💸 for employees residing in Spain. Team building activities 🎳🍻🍕 Referral Bonus if you bring other talented people like you.

title: Product Manager
description: The Product Manager is responsible for improving The Fabricant Platform and related products; working closely with our Founders and Tech team you will build a user-centred product roadmap and drive discovery & delivery of product features that maximise value for our customers business and community. To succeed in this role you have a deep understanding of Web3 and its technology and have experience with continuously iterating on product features according to user feedback and business needs. You understand how to develop strategy and connect it to action and the right KPI’s for measuring success.Note: We are looking for candidates based in a European time zone.   Responsibilities:  Drive product development through continuous customer research resulting in product traction and an increase in revenue Work with our Founders Tech Design and Marketing teams to develop strategy and get a validated roadmap in place that has the buy-in of the whole organisation Translate the strategy into tangible action items that focus our efforts on a daily/weekly basis Evangelise an agile way of working and desigproduct thinking culture Share insights from customer or market research on a regular basis Elevate our Product team to the next level in terms of performance and team culture Work closely with the Product Design Product Marketing and Product Owner to continuously evolve the product Review product results test and evaluate hypothesis leading to incremental improvements Work with the Head of Marketing to drive users and implement exciting campaigns and experiences  Must haves  3+ years significant experience as Product Manager in complex digital product environments Active participation or experience (even better) in web3 Experience with finding product-market fit for B2B or even better B2B2C companies 3+ years significant lead experience and demonstrated success in project managing the release of complex digital products and services that meet and exceed business objectives Experience and passion in one or more of Fashion Gaming Blockchain & Emerging Technologies Excellent detailed written and verbal communication and presentation skills including use of project management/communication and design tools like Miro/Jira/Confluence/Figma Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority. The ability to influence and work collaboratively with development teams is key Experience with hiring and managing high performing individuals  Nice to have’s  Knowledgeable about gaming as a hobby or via direct work experience VFX background Worked with emerging technologies Having worked in blockchain projects  Why The Fabricant?  We were one of the first digital-only Fashion houses; disruption and revolution are in our blood We are creative + curious; from Fashion Design to VFX to Crypto Tokenomics we are home to a wildly diverse set of skills & talent All that we do centres around our 3 values: Impact Curiosity & Empathy We are helping to ready the metaverse by building a B2B2C platform that is sustainable equitable and sexy We are helping to ready the metaverse for wider adoption Helping to realise a diverse web3 industry is our passion 2 of our 3 Co-Founders are female  You believe in our mission and champion The Fabricant values:  Impact:Ever-challenging our ways of working to maximise our output as we help shape a more equitable and sustainable Fashion industry.Curiosity:Continually challenging ourselves and asking questions to foster exploration education and play in our collective pursuit of innovation.Empathy:Leading with our hearts as much as our heads; actively listen with compassion + sensitivity to build stronger relationships foster inclusivity and cultivate an environment where everyone feels valued.

title: Production Designer, Video
description: As the industry leader in automotive marketing we’re trusted by the best dealers in North America. From innovative solutions to support from trusted experts making marketing easier is our job. PureCars provides everything dealers need to attract and convert more customers with tech-driven solutions unmatched data capabilities and direct access to support. We are a certified digital provider for 18 OEM programs and compliant with over 40 brands. We also serve 65 of the top 100 dealer groups in North America. We are proud to partner with leading organizations such as Google Meta Amazon Spotify Disney+ Microsoft Oracle and others to offer the widest range of advertising channels to our dealership clients. We are focused on investing in world-class talent and technology in order to help our partners dominate their markets in new and innovative ways. Job Summary - Video Production Designer (Remote - EST or CST Preferred) PureCars is seeking a Video Production Designer to join our Creative team to help serve the advertising needs of our automotive clients throughout the US and Canada. The Video Designer will partner with internal account managers and our Performance team to create digital design assets to be seen by users across social media programmatic display and Youtube advertisements. If you are ready to roll up your sleeves and build snappy beautiful video content we’d love to hear from you! Salary Range: $65 000 - $75 000 Video Production Designer - What You’ll Do:  Create revise and assemble a wide variety of digital assets for display social mobile and video ads using the Adobe Creative Suite including After Effect Premiere Photoshop etc. Learn and understand the specific requirements for all automotive OEM video advertising guidelines and ensure that all work meets departmental standards and OEM compliance regulations. Utilize dynamic video tools and work with importing data to various video templates to render out large batches of video.  Help build new design templates to quickly replicate creative assets across multiple client groups and use existing templates to update or create new monthly video ads. Take direction and requests from customers to create new videos while incorporating specific footage callout text banners/graphics design aesthetic and/or specific audio. Proactively communicate with internal teams to ensure that video project updates general questions or follow-up are happening as needed. Excellent eye for detail combined with a creative mind for developing catchy intuitive video materials.  Required Skills/Abilities:  Prior experience in video design and creation using Adobe Creative Suite (After Effects Adobe Premiere Adobe Photoshop etc.) either directly for a brand or with an agency. Strong knowledge of ad layout principles and aesthetic design concepts as well as current online media trends and technology. Ability to work in a fast-paced deadline-oriented environment in which meticulous attention to detail is required. Keyframe animation knowledge including ease iease out and elements in motion is a major plus. Experience in audio editing such as knowing how to trim edit adjust levels and fade as well as basic experience working with HTML5/CSS is a plus. The ability to write basic ad copy or scripts for videos is a plus.  Perks at PureCars:  Rich Benefits Plans - Health dental vision 401(k) paid parental leave and more! Open PTO Policy - Take what you need when you need it. Internal Growth - Over ⅓ of the positions opened and filled are with our own employees.  Work From Anywhere - From home the beach or your favorite coffee shop. Work where you want to! Learning and Development - Robust new employee onboarding leadership and management training.  Radical Transparency - All employees have direct access to our executive leadership whether in recurring town halls or direct conversation and mentorship.  Diversity & Inclusion - Come one come all! Between ongoing training panels celebrations and more our DEI team ensures every employee knows they belong here.  PureCars is committed to building diverse teams and upholding an equal employment workplace that is free from discrimination. We hire amazing individuals regardless of their race color ancestry religion sex gender identity national origin sexual orientation age citizenship marital status pregnancy medical conditions genetic information disability or Veteran status. Just be passionate genuine collaborative data-driven and entrepreneurial at heart!

title: Program Manager, Customer Success Operations
description: Company DescriptionSince we opened our doors in 2009 the world of commerce has evolved immensely and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale we saw sellers stymied by disparate outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together.  So we expanded into software and started building integrated omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online manage inventory offer buy now pay later functionality through Afterpay book appointments engage loyal buyers and hire and pay staff. Across it all we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper increase order sizes and compete at a larger scale.  Today we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations sellers just starting as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a significant meaningful and lasting business and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.Job DescriptionThe Global Program Management and Infrastructure team ensures the smooth and efficient running of the Customer Success organization on a daily basis. With offices in the US Canada Japan Ireland Australia Poland Taiwan Guatemala and other locations we improve both quality of output and cost efficiency of the global organization while also ensuring timely execution of essential strategic projects for the growing Customer Success team. As a Program Manager in Customer Success Operations youll work cross functionally — with other Operations teams with the broader Customer Success organization and beyond — to plan and build towards the global vision of CS. You will report to an Operations Program Management Lead.You Will: Develop project plans with clear scope and deliverables across all impacted functional areas. Youll play a large part in helping us further define and build our global strategyGather and organize information on CSs largest opportunities for improved efficiency and quality of serviceSupport product launches from discovery to implementation in collaboration with Product Teams CS stakeholders and other go to market organizationsBe the organizing body that brings all impacted parties together orchestrating all workstreams towards a common goalProvide seamless change management for initiatives impacting the global team – ensuring no detail is left out and all impacts are accounted forEnsure our organizational key performance indicators (KPIs) are being measured and met through each program you manageQualificationsYou Have:5+ years of project or program management work experienceExcellent soft skills catered towards a variety of stakeholder functions. Youre able to clearly and concisely communicate an idea or overall project/ program statusThe ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously often with competing resourcesA keen eye for prioritization and continuous optimization; you have the ability to discern the urgency and importance of workExperience launching products is a plusExperience with Jira is a plusManagement consulting experience is a plusAdditional InformationBlock takes a market-based approach to pay and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills experience qualifications work location and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.  Zone A: USD $125 600 - USD $153 600 Zone B: USD $116 800 - USD $142 800 Zone C: USD $110 500 - USD $135 100 Zone D: USD $100 500 - USD $122 900To find a location’s zone designation please refer to this resource. If a location of interest is not listed please speak with a recruiter for additional information. Full-time employee benefits include the following:Healthcare coverage (Medical Vision and Dental insurance)Health Savings Account and Flexible Spending AccountRetirement Plans including company match Employee Stock Purchase ProgramWellness programs including access to mental health 1:1 financial planners and a monthly wellness allowance Paid parental and caregiving leavePaid time off (including 12 paid holidays)Paid sick leave (1 hour per 26 hours worked (max 80 hours per calendar year to the extent legally permissible) for non-exempt employees and covered by our Flexible Time Off policy for exempt employees) Learning and Development resourcesPaid Life insurance AD&D and disability benefits These benefits are further detailed in Blocks policies. This role is also eligible to participate in Blocks equity plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies and may be eligible for a sign-on bonus. Sales roles may be eligible to participate in a commission plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies. Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans. We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently without regard to race color religion gender national origin age disability veteran status pregnancy gender expression or identity sexual orientation citizenship or any other legally protected class. We believe in being fair and are committed to an inclusive interview experience including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.Additionally we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team assessing candidates in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.  Block Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square Cash App Spiral TIDAL and TBD we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions business software and banking services. With Cash App anyone can easily send spend or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

title: Customer Success Manager
description: Our Mission Provide security teams with breakthrough visibility and control over all high-value enterprise data transforming how organizations protect their data from IP theft and insider threats.   About the Role This is an ideal opportunity for a highly motivated individual to get in on the ground floor as we build out our Customer Experience functions at Cyberhaven.  You will become an expert on Cyberhaven’s DDR platform understand how it interacts with customers’ environments and how customers can reduce threats across the organization. You will help our customers operationalize Data Detection and Response! You will own the relationship across the entire customer journey - ensuring seamless introduction of the Cyberhaven platform to drive value optimize and operationalize outcomes. Ideally you will be comfortable speaking with security and customer operation teams. You must have deep technical depth be “client obsessed” and have proven experience with a SaaS-based data protection security product; have the desire to take initiative consistently be oriented with proving value for customers and love working in a fast paced high growth environment is key. Reports to the Head of Customer Experience.   Activities & Responsibilities   Own the end-to-end customer relationship collaborate with professional services in seamless onboarding and ensure our clients understand all aspects of the Cyberhaven solution   Identify establish and build deep relationships with current and potential senior stakeholders within your accounts   Leverage knowledge of the Cyberhaven platform industry trends and data protection best practices to develop long-term growth plans as a strategic partner to our customers.   Ensure swift resolution of customer issues by leveraging resources from cross-functional teams while being the voice of the customer   Embody Cyberhaven values and serve as a role model for other team members   Understand your customers’ pain points and how they want to improve their corporate risk exposure so you can map the Cyberhaven platform to meet these key objectives   Partner closely with Marketing to develop your key stakeholders into advocates   Expand Cyberhaven’s footprint or feature set in the organization as well as identify upsell cross-sell and other growth opportunities   Own and run client business reviews for our strategic customers   Be data-obsessed and assist our clients in using analytics to prove value and show how the Cyberhaven solution has decreased their risk exposure.      Requirements For Position   Experience - 5+ years of success in senior roles in enterprise SaaS deployment CSM and/or program management for large complex and strategic customers is required. Prior work experience as a Technical Account Manager or Sales Engineer focused on endpoint protection solutions is desired.    Leadership - This role requires strong communication skills as well as displaying executive presence and confidence in varying levels of customer situations. The Sr. CSM must display leadership with personnel at Cyberhaven’s customers who will be engaged in the delivery and ongoing management of our platform   Relationship Building - Proven track record of building relationships with senior customer executives in large and mid-sized accounts. Experience managing various stakeholder relationships to generate consensus on bringing a data protection program and platform to life   Program Management - Excellent skills in managing a portfolio of engagements cross-group collaboration resource orchestration communications analytical capabilities and attention to detail required. The Sr. CSM will be accountable for the operational health of the customer solutions deployed today and in the future.   Collaboration and Communication - Proven track record of driving decisions collaboratively resolving conflicts and ensuring follow-through with verbal and written communication. Strong presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences and various levels of management (CISO Senior Executives Day-to-Day Operations Team).   Technical - Knowledgeable and experienced in designing developing deploying and supporting complex cloud technology solutions. Strong knowledge of Data Loss Prevention technologies Windows and macOS systems and Cloud applications and is critical   Familiarity with technologies that are adjacent to Cyberhaven in which we integrate (SIEM SOAR UEBA) are desired.   Knowledge of security controls for the handling of sensitive data types.   Experience with performing technical analysis as well as handling documentation and project management aspects of an incident response regarding data security issues.   Understanding of macOS and Windows environments.   Expertise with DLP Insider Threat and CASB solutions   Familiarity with cloud apps and services.   Excellent communication and interpersonal skills required with a passion for the cloud and related new technologies.     What you can count on:   Remote-friendly culture.   $130 000 to $150 000   Paid medical/dental/vision benefits for you and your family with the option to buy up to a premium medical plan   Flexible time off.   Potential fast-tracked career advancement opportunities.   Experience building something from the ground up.   At Cyberhaven weve raised over $52M from leading Silicon Valley investors (Vertex Costanoa and Redpoint). Cyberhaven is also backed by founders executives and security leaders who have built transformational technologies at Nutanix Palo Alto Networks Facebook Google Slack Akamai Cloudera AsterData and others. We have strong demand for our product from the world’s largest companies and we are growing fast.   Cyberhaven is committed to creating a diverse environment and is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color religion gender gender identity or expression sexual orientation national origin genetics disability age or veteran status.

title: Senior Symfony Developer
description: The Role:   We are looking for a Senior Symfony developer with commercial experience for one of our clients. You are a perfect candidate if you are growth-oriented you love what you do and you enjoy working on new ideas to develop exciting products and growth features.
